intro: Lepisanthes chrysotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired lepisanthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, yellowish-white spadix surrounded by a broad, greenish-white spathe. Lepisanthes chrysotricha is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and exotic appearance.
